text: The Bulgarian Communist Party (Bulgarian: Българска комунистическа партия; shortened BCP) was the ruling political party in Bulgaria from 1946 until 1990. The party led a coup against the tsarist government in 1944.„Деветосептемврийски преврат“, Encyclopedia Bulgaria, Professor Vasil Gyuzelev, Bulgarian Academy of Sciences, "Trud" Publishing House, 2012, с. 1701 (item 5) (item 5) Todor Zhivkov was leader of the party and Bulgaria from 1954 until 1989. He was the longest-serving leader of any Eastern Bloc nation. The party's first leader was Dimitar Blagoev. On 11 December 1989, leader Petar Mladenov announced that the party was giving up its guaranteed right to rule. In 1990, the party became much more moderate and was no longer a communist party. In April 1990, the party changed its name to the Bulgarian Socialist Party (BSP). == References == Category:1919 establishments in Europe Category:1989 disestablishments in Europe Category:20th-century establishments in Bulgaria Category:Communist parties in Europe Category:Political parties in Bulgaria
